prompt: <description>**Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge** The first part is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.125, 0.0]. Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of a series of lines and an arc. - Line 1: Start at [0.0, 0.0], End at [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start at [0.75, 0.0], End at [0.75, 0.125] - Line 3: Start at [0.75, 0.125], End at [0.6296, 0.25] - Arc 1: Start at [0.6296, 0.25], Mid at [0.375, 0.125], End at [0.1204, 0.25] - Line 4: Start at [0.1204, 0.25], End at [0.0, 0.125] - Line 5: Start at [0.0, 0.125], End at [0.0, 0.0] The loop is closed, consisting of 5 curves (4 lines and 1 arc). The sketch is then scaled by a factor of 0.75. The scaled 2D sketch is then transformed into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.125 units to create the 3D model. The operation is a "New Body Feature Operation". The final dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.125 units - Height: 0.25 units (from the base) + 0.125 units (from the extrusion) = 0.375 units.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.125,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.125],"End Point":[0.6296,0.25]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.6296,0.25],"Mid Point":[0.375,0.125],"End Point":[0.1204,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.1204,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.125]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.125],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.125,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base of the prism 1. **Define the coordinate system**: Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.7255, 0.0. 2. **Create the 2D sketch**: Draw a sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. **Draw the loops**: - Loop 1: Draw 4 lines to form a rectangle. - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.2337) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.2337), End Point (0.0, 0.2337) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.2337), End Point (0.0, 0.0) - Loop 2: Draw another rectangle, slightly smaller than the previous one and centered inside. - Line 1: Start Point (0.0136, 0.0136), End Point (0.7364, 0.0136) - Line 2: Start Point (0.7364, 0.0136), End Point (0.7364, 0.2201) - Line 3: Start Point (0.7364, 0.2201), End Point (0.0136, 0.2201) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0136, 0.2201), End Point (0.0136, 0.0136) 4. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Scale the entire 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D**: Apply the euler angles (-90, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0.7255, 0) to the 2D sketch to generate a 3D sketch. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch**: Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.7255 units along the positive Z direction. Part 2 Instructions Add a slanted face to the prism 1. **Define the coordinate system**: Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector to 0.0136, 0.7255, 0.0136. 2. **Create the 2D sketch**: Draw a sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. **Draw the loops**: - Loop 1: Draw 4 lines to form a rectangle. - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.7228, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.7228, 0.0), End Point (0.7228, 0.2065) - Line 3: Start Point (0.7228, 0.2065), End Point (0.0, 0.2065) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.2065), End Point (0.0, 0.0) 4. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Scale the entire 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7228. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D**: Apply the euler angles (-90, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0.7255, 0) to the 2D sketch to generate a 3D sketch. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch**: Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0204 units along the positive Z direction.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the location specified in the JSON, with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 degrees. Using this coordinate system, create a new sketch on the XY plane. The sketch should consist of a single face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1) that traces the perimeter of the rectangle. The loop should consist of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4) that form the rectangle. Once the sketch is complete, scale it by a factor of 0.465 and create a 3D sketch from it using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the JSON. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to the depth specified in the JSON. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hole in the center** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the location specified in the JSON, with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 degrees. Using this coordinate system, create a new sketch on the XY plane. The sketch should consist of three faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, and face\\_3). Face\\_1 should have one loop (loop\\_1) that traces the perimeter of the rectangle on the left side of the sketch. The loop should consist of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4) that form the rectangle. Face\\_2 should have one loop (loop\\_1) that traces the perimeter of the rectangle on the right side of the sketch. The loop should consist of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4) that form the rectangle. Face\\_3 should have two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2). Loop\\_1 should trace the perimeter of the rectangle on the right side of the sketch, and should be identical to loop\\_1 on face\\_2. Loop\\_2 should trace the perimeter of the hole in the center of the sketch. It should consist of two arcs (arc\\_1 and arc\\_2) and two lines (line\\_1 and line\\_2) that form a circle. Once the sketch is complete, extrude it along the Z-axis to the depth specified in the JSON. The final extrusion should be a solid body with a hole in the center. **Part 3: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the location specified in the JSON, with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees. Using this coordinate system, create a new sketch on the XZ plane. The sketch should consist of one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1) that traces the perimeter of the rectangle. The loop should consist of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4) that form the rectangle. Once the sketch is complete, scale it by a factor of 0.18 and create a 3D sketch from it using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the JSON. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the Y-axis to the depth specified in the JSON to create a rectangular prism with rounded corners.</description>
